firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore structure is designed to store and manage landing page content components such as Hero Sections, Navbars, Feature Sections, About Sections, Testimonial Sections, Testimonials, and Footers. Each content section is stored in its own top-level collection. This approach promotes structural segregation (Strategy B) by ensuring that each collection houses documents with the same security posture, simplifying security rules. Each collection stores the data as specified in the provided schema.

Authorization Independence (Strategy A) is achieved because each document only contains its own data and does not rely on parent documents for authorization. Since there's no user-specific data or collaborative data, we don't need to denormalize any user information or membership maps.

QAPs (Rules are not Filters) is supported by maintaining separate top-level collections for each entity type. This segregation ensures that listing operations can be secured at the collection level without needing to filter documents based on their content. Thus, security rules will be simple and efficient.

Each entity type has its own collection (e.g., `heroSections`, `navbars`), which allows for easy querying and management of content components.
